steps.title: Boil pasta
steps.description: Boil salted water and cook spaghetti until al dente, reserving ½ cup pasta water.
steps.demonstration: Watch the water bubble in a fervent dance as you steadily lower the spaghetti for even cooking.
steps.helpfulTip: Salt your water generously; testing the pasta a minute early ensures perfect al dente texture.

steps.title: Fry pancetta
steps.description: Fry pancetta in olive oil until crispy.
steps.demonstration: Observe the pancetta as it sizzles and transforms, the fat rendering into a golden, crisp symphony.
steps.helpfulTip: Keep the heat moderate to avoid burning, achieving crisp perfection without bitterness.

steps.title: Whisk egg mixture
steps.description: Whisk egg yolks with grated Parmesan and black pepper.
steps.demonstration: Whisk vigorously until your mixture becomes a smooth, golden cascade reminiscent of a sunrise.
steps.helpfulTip: Gently beat to prevent froth—aim for a creamy, uniform blend that will effortlessly coat your pasta.

steps.title: Combine pasta and pancetta
steps.description: Combine drained pasta with pancetta, remove from heat, and mix in egg mixture.
steps.demonstration: Fold the ingredients with a delicate, measured touch—a culinary dance that marries texture and flavor.
steps.helpfulTip: Remove from heat before adding the eggs to prevent scrambling, using pasta water to fine-tune the sauce’s consistency.

steps.title: Add pasta water
steps.description: Add pasta water gradually to create a creamy sauce.
steps.demonstration: Drizzle the starchy water slowly, watching the sauce thicken like a painter blending vibrant hues.
steps.helpfulTip: Add in small increments—the starch in the water is your ally in achieving a silky, emulsified sauce.

steps.title: Serve
steps.description: Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.
steps.demonstration: Plate your dish with a flourish, a final act of artistry accented by a sprinkle of extra cheese and pepper.
steps.helpfulTip: Enjoy while hot; the sauce sets quickly once it cools, so serve immediately for the best texture.

steps.title: Preheat oven
steps.description: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
steps.demonstration: Set the stage as the oven warms to a perfect 350°F, an essential prelude to your baking performance.
steps.helpfulTip: Ensure a consistent oven temperature by verifying with an oven thermometer if available.

steps.title: Cream butter and sugars
steps.description: Cream butter and sugars together until fluffy.
steps.demonstration: Blend the butter and sugars into a light, airy mixture—a sweet alchemy that paves the way for tender cookies.
steps.helpfulTip: Proper creaming introduces air, which is key for a soft texture; take your time.

steps.title: Beat in eggs and vanilla
steps.description: Beat in eggs and vanilla extract.
steps.demonstration: Gently fold in eggs and vanilla, blending them into the mixture until a silky consistency prevails.
steps.helpfulTip: Room temperature eggs mix more evenly, ensuring a harmonious batter.

steps.title: Mix dry ingredients
steps.description: Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl, then gradually combine with wet ingredients.
steps.demonstration: Whisk the dry ingredients with a steady rhythm, creating a foundation as dependable as a well-kept secret.
steps.helpfulTip: Sift your dry mix to avoid lumps and ensure even distribution when combined with the wet ingredients.

steps.title: Fold in chocolate chips
steps.description: Fold in chocolate chips.
steps.demonstration: Gently incorporate the chocolate chips, scattering them like treasures through the dough.
steps.helpfulTip: Avoid overmixing to preserve the tender, chewy texture of your cookies.

steps.title: Bake cookies
steps.description: Drop spoonfuls of dough onto the baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes until golden brown.
steps.demonstration: Watch the dough transform in the oven’s warm embrace, edges crisping while centers remain soft and inviting.
steps.helpfulTip: Check a minute early to avoid overbaking—cookies continue to firm up once removed from the oven.

steps.title: Cool cookies
steps.description: Cool on a wire rack before serving.
steps.demonstration: Let the cookies rest on a rack, their enticing aroma lingering like whispered secrets of sweetness.
steps.helpfulTip: Cooling prevents residual heat from compromising texture; let them set to perfection on a wire rack.

steps.title: Preheat oven
steps.description: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
steps.demonstration: Set the canvas ablaze with preheated warmth—a necessary prelude to muffin magic.
steps.helpfulTip: A well-preheated oven and properly lined tin ensure even rising and easy release.

steps.title: Mix dry ingredients
steps.description: In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
steps.demonstration: Let the dry ingredients mingle in a rhythmic swirl, creating a foundation of flavor and aroma.
steps.helpfulTip: Sifting these ingredients can boost aeration, ensuring a light and even muffin crumb.

steps.title: Mix wet ingredients
steps.description: In a separate bowl, whisk together brown sugar, eggs, oil, and vanilla until well combined.
steps.demonstration: Blend the wet ingredients until they sing in harmony—a smooth, sweet overture to your batter.
steps.helpfulTip: Mix until just combined to keep the muffins tender; overmixing may result in toughness.

steps.title: Add bananas and pineapple
steps.description: Stir in mashed bananas and crushed pineapple.
steps.demonstration: Fold in the tropical burst of bananas and pineapple—a colorful medley that brings vibrancy to every bite.
steps.helpfulTip: Mix gently to maintain fruit texture and ensure even flavor distribution.

steps.title: Combine dry and wet ingredients
steps.description: Gradually mix in dry ingredients until just combined.
steps.demonstration: Merge the two worlds with a delicate stir, uniting them like kindred spirits on a single journey.
steps.helpfulTip: Stir only until no dry patches remain—overmixing can cause a dense, heavy muffin.

steps.title: Fold in nuts
steps.description: Fold in chopped pecans.
steps.demonstration: Gently sprinkle the chopped pecans, allowing crunchy accents to dot your batter like autumn leaves.
steps.helpfulTip: Fold with care to retain the muffins’ airy structure while adding a delightful crunch.

steps.title: Scoop batter
steps.description: Scoop batter into muffin cups, filling each about ¾ full.
steps.demonstration: Spoon the luscious batter into each cup with precision, creating uniform little works of edible art.
steps.helpfulTip: Fill each cup about 75% full to allow the muffins room to rise without spilling over.

steps.title: Bake muffins
steps.description: Bake for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
steps.demonstration: Watch as your muffins undergo a golden transformation, emerging soft yet structured from the oven’s embrace.
steps.helpfulTip: Test with a toothpick towards the end of baking; avoid opening the oven frequently to maintain temperature.

steps.title: Cool muffins
steps.description: Let cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
steps.demonstration: Allow the muffins to cool, their inviting aroma lingering like a gentle lullaby on the senses.
steps.helpfulTip: Cooling on a rack prevents moisture buildup, ensuring your muffins retain their delicate texture.

steps.title: Cook the pasta
steps.description: Cook penne pasta in a large pot of boiling water until tender. Drain and set aside.
steps.demonstration: Watch the pasta boil vigorously, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
steps.helpfulTip: Add a pinch of salt to the boiling water to enhance pasta flavor.

steps.title: Prepare the arrabbiata sauce
steps.description: In a skillet over medium heat, add olive oil, minced garlic, and crushed red pepper flakes; cook for 30 seconds. Add whole peeled tomatoes and tomato paste, crushing the tomatoes with the back of a spoon. Simmer for 10 minutes, then remove from heat and stir in chopped fresh basil.
steps.demonstration: Observe the sauce as it simmers, thickening and melding the flavors together.
steps.helpfulTip: Adjust the amount of red pepper flakes to control the spiciness of the sauce.

steps.title: Combine pasta and sauce
steps.description: Add the cooked pasta to the skillet with the arrabbiata sauce. Toss to combine and heat through. Serve immediately, garnished with freshly grated parmesan cheese and chopped parsley.
steps.demonstration: Gently toss the pasta and sauce until each piece is evenly coated.
steps.helpfulTip: Reserve a bit of pasta cooking water to adjust the sauce consistency if needed.

ingredients.item: pistachio instant pudding and pie filling mix

steps.title: Prepare oven and baking pan
steps.description: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a 13- x 9-inch baking pan with cooking spray; set aside.
steps.demonstration: Watch how to properly preheat and prepare your baking pan for best results.
steps.helpfulTip: Make sure your oven is fully preheated before placing your cake inside.

steps.title: Make cake batter
steps.description: Beat cake mix, sparkling water, oil, eggs, 1 package of the pudding mix, and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Fold in coconut, pecans, and pistachios.
steps.demonstration: Mix until just combined for a fluffy texture.
steps.helpfulTip: Avoid overmixing to keep the cake light and airy.

steps.title: Bake cake
steps.description: Pour into prepared pan, and spread in an even layer. Bake in preheated oven until top is lightly golden and a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool completely in pan on a wire rack, about 1 1/2 hours.
steps.demonstration: Check for doneness with a toothpick.
steps.helpfulTip: Let the cake cool completely to prevent the frosting from melting.

steps.title: Make frosting
steps.description: Beat cream in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until just starting to thicken, about 3 minutes. Add powdered sugar, 3 tablespoons of the remaining pudding mix, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt; beat on medium speed until thickened and smooth, about 1 minute. Spoon onto cooled cake, spreading into an even layer; swirl decoratively if desired. Garnish with coconut and pistachios.
steps.demonstration: Watch how to create a smooth frosting finish.
steps.helpfulTip: Use cold cream for easier whipping.
